In order to clear some space in the cellar I grabbed this still fresh bottle of Redemption and cracked it open on a lazy evening. Proving Russian River is more than just a branding ploy, this Belgian sparkles with qualities that should make it a daily drinker for those lucky enough to live on the West Coast.

Aroma / Appearance - A cloudy base mixes warm caramel with golden yellow. Slow falling white head melts like snowflakes. Light yeast, lemon, and citrus aspects tickle the air with a bright feel.

Flavor / Palate - A full body of sourdough bread, lemon butter, and citrus punch through the palate. A malty core gives smooth depth. A very easy drinking release compares favorably to anything you would run across in the Midwest including the best staples from Jolly Pumpkin. I will have to try future batches the next time I travel west.

A - Pours cloudy straw yellow with a thin film of white head leaving little to no lacing down the glass.


S - The nose is a tad spicy from all that yeast. The yeast leaves a dry impression that will carry on throughout the glass. A nice light funk provides a bit of earthiness and works well with some citrus fruits to offer some type of contrast to all that yeast.


T - My immediate reaction was to check and make sure I had the right bottle, this thing could easily be from Belgium. Light funk with a touch of zest up front but that flavor is quickly overtaken by a dry, overbearing, yeast presence. Some light spices and a bit of sweetness are an excellent contrast to the strong yeast core. Pretty good for a lighter beer. Glad I tried it.


M - Light body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Refreshing feel from the light funk, drying the pallet quickly. Finish is a bit chewy with some of it lingering long after consumption.


D - Pretty good. I enjoyed this one but it wasnt mind blowing by any means. Solid stuff none the less. Glad I finally got to try this one.

Bouteille avec bouchon de liège de la batch 040413. Bière blonde jaune dorée avec une mousse blanche. Un nez de levure belge, de malt blond (pils) dépice et de houblon noble. La bouche un peu mielleuse agréable, avec des levures belges bien présentes. Une bière facile et agréable, une belle concoction simple de Russian River un de mes brasseurs préférés.

Une mousse compacte et crémeuse chevauche une robe blonde et légèrement troublée. Jobserve une dentelle qui sinstalle comme un rideau de givre. Le nez dévoile des choses qui sont intéressantes et des choses qui sarticulent autour de lordinaire. Je hume du blé, des malts pâles légèrement mielleux, du champagne, des épices et des fruits jaunes. Le goût est plutôt large. Il y a des saveurs de banane et de citron. Je reconnais la coriandre ou des épices qui partagent le même cheminement moléculaire. Je mords dans du blé et je pense à la fusion entre les bières allemandes et les blondes belges. Au palais, jy trouve un corps de moyenne densité avec un pétillement à leuropéenne. La texture crémeuse me va à ravir. La finale est propre, houblonnée, sèche et plutôt courte.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2011 Beer dinner at iron abbey. Golden color with some spice notes, I noticed what I had seemed a little flat. And after pouring a new bottle, it actually does have nice carbonation.

Pours a bright hazy orange. Aroma is bread dough, fruity Belgian esters. Super dry. Phenolic yeast flavors, finishes really dry in the end. Carbonation is lively. Some lemon and pepper notes. Quaffable.
Bottle. Batch 010. Poured light golden, hazy yellow with little head that retained. Very nice belgian yeast aromas and flavours. A little grassy/grain aroma and finish. Very smooth.
batch 002 (i think). my first Russian River so i was pretty excited. not bad, just not great. a decent example of the style, just nothing out the ordinary
(draft at Trinity 10/30/10). Clear gold color. Medium white head. Light citrus and malt aroma and flavor. Avg duration. Light dry finish. Thin/slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Good lacing.

Pours lemon yellow with a slight hazed. A tall frothy head is exhumed throwing off aromas like lemon peel, white spices and zest. Medium nectar with good carbonation. Good aroma to taste buds follow through. This brew is very wet in the mouth at first then a biting bitterness sets in that makes my pours pucker leaving my innards dry at the foundation. Reminds me of when I used to pour salt on rattlesnake hide for curing. The salt sucks out all the moisture from the hide. Then Id make a belt or hat band out of it. I remember selling one to my grandmother. I like the lasting dryness and bittering on the finish. Very drinkable. This is a classic!

bottle of batch 10... medium honey gold with a bit of cream, a huge off white head, great retention and lacing... subtle nose but I like it, a bit of yeast with some deep sweetness to it, honey with cream... the taste is a bit boring, the subtleness of the nose comes across as a bit boring, this tastes good but blah

Pours a very pale yellow with a medium white head...nice lacing.  Aroma is yeasty...some spice...clove...some leather, hint of funk, a bit earthy.  Flavor is sason like...spicy with light citrus notes...faint cloviness.  Mouthfeel is light and a bit lively.  Finish is dry and has a spiced citrus feel to it.  Decent but not outstanding.

Had this during the 2011 Shenandoah Throwdown.  Another one of those that I thought I had rated (pretty sure I even have bottles of it in my cellar) but took notes anyway. Pours a hazed golden blonde with a thin white head.  Lightly minty on the nose, with some soft wheat.  Cool and clean, nice fuzzy musk notes popping up.  Wheat and more musk on the finish. Pours highlighter yellow with froth white head. Aroma is tart with a little sweet and spice. Taste is light lemon clean hops. Great mouthfeel. Thx darn1207.

8/26/11. 375mL bottle, batch 010, courtesy darn1207! Very cloudy golden pour with a very small white head that fades. Very light aroma with Belgian yeast, a touch of rubber, funk, and some lemon... reminds me of a Berliner weiss. Light flavor with a touch of grainy malt, some lemon peel, and more lingering graininess with a touch of funk. Interesting.

Pale straw with good, creamy, white head / Light nose of lemon, orchard fruit, and brett funk / Light to medium body, moderately tart and acidic, creamy, with good balance and lightly bitter finish / Elegant flavors of apple, pear, lemon, banana, crysanthemum, violets, straw, soap, cream, honey, and white pepper / A light, fresh, delicious and sessionable Belgian.

375ml bottle purch. in CO.  Batch #010.  First Russian River Beer.  meh.
hazy yellow pour.  cant quite account for all ofthe aroma; several things in there - got slight citrus.  Taste - not much up front; then slight peppery carbonation with a tart/peculiar finish.  dont see the greatness; although I am not that familiar with this style

Really a fine beer, especially given the relativley low abv %.  Nice cloudy yellow color.  Flavor is citrus, yeast and sunshine.  Yes, sunshine.

Batch 008 bottle courtesy of obguthr at the 15th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering, 7/16/11. Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow with a medium sized creamy offwhite head. Good head retention and lacing. If youre familiar with Belgian beer youve probably heard of the styles dubbel, tripel and quad, but have you ever heard of a Belgian single? Yes, such a style exists but is rarely brewed outside the walls of a Trappist monastery intended for the monks personal consumption (better known as a "paters bier"). Ive reviewed three of these rare beers, so I was very eager to try Russian River Redemption - an American attempt at this niche Belgian style. I must say they got the style down pat! Not that its the worlds best beer or anything, just a good one.I poured a 12oz corked bottle into a Trappist chalice.Appearance: Bright yellow, mostly clear until the yeast slips in then become hazy. Massive carbonation present. Not much head, though - just a thin coating of white soapy suds. No lacing.Smell: Mild aromatics of green fruits (especially white grape) and peppery yeast esters. Taste: Upon my first sip of Redemption I was amazed by how well an American brewery has emulated an authentic Belgian Trappist style. Immediately I feel an intense tingling of spices and carbonation dancing on my tongue. The palate is light, but spicy on both halves - grassy hop spiciness across the front, and dry black pepper on the rear. Theres a noticeable tobacco-like flavor as well not commonly found in beers of this range. It could be clove or clove-like flavors from the yeast (commonly found in German hefeweizens), but Im not sure if that or any other spice is used in the brewing of this beer.Drinkability: I always find Belgian "singles" of this sort to be a liquid paradox. Theyre light-bodied to be sure, but their palates contain the energy levels of much strong beers. Redemption is quite spicy in the mouth and combined with its extremely effervescent body - its not a beer that can be slugged down easily. Even though it finishes clean, I wouldnt call it refreshing since its so lively in the mouth. The 5.15% ABV seems right, as this beer definitely has more weight to it than the lighter Trappist blondes that inspired it.Overall, an impressive beer for reasons (especially considering its only a 12oz bottle and its caged and corked). Not absolutely delicious, but tasty and satisfying.NOTE: Watch the video version of this review at:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uM32HG7nsOI

Batch 009 Bottle; Pour is light cloudy gold with a fantastic frothy white head that retains well, laces well. Light citrus note on the nose, with a bit of lemongrass, I suppose. .3l draft Pours a light gold with a very small head. Smells of yeast, and light hops.  Very light mouthfeel and light body, a very easy drking belgian

Poured from a 375ml bottle at Fresh Craft into a snifter.

A: Pours a hazy golden straw appearance. Head is present but fades rather fast, not a lot of action or stability but the lacing is very pretty.

S: Musky and yeasty right off the bat. Hints of spice linger on through the aroma with wild funk backing it up. A hint of earthiness and apples rise and fall through the nose.

T: Very delicate beer. Incredibly balanced between the yeast spice notes with caramelized malts. While not cloying the sugar is present but not the main flavor going on. Pears and apples dominate the fruit but only backup the spice and yeast. Hops are low and malt is high, lemon grass, terroir, earth, and musk are the main flavors. Finishes clean and refreshing. Moderate linger.

M: Moderate but not heavy in weight on the palate. Cotes the palate very evenly and lightly. The carbonation is fantastic and balances the richness of this beer.

D: Lovely beer! Sipping this reminds me of what the monks would drink while eating their bread. Very balanced, soft, and delicate with great earthy musty notes balanced with spice and yeast and rounded out with pears and soft green apples.

Hazed straw gold, large, loose white head.  Lemony nose, coriander spiciness, yeast, a little honey.  Light on the palate, surprisingly dry.  More coriander, lemon, herbal notes, very light on the flavor, just a toasty crackery hint at the start.  Pretty distinctive stuff.

Batch 9.  Raw doughy nose, little gummy, chewy foggy yeast.  Hazy pale yellow, almost white in places with a thick meringue head. 375 mL bottle, batch 009, pours cloudy golden/orange with a large white head. Aroma of sour dough, slight lemon zest, and spices. Taste of coriander, herbal notes, bread, fruits, with a bitter grassy finish. Enjoyable.

Bottle from Capones. Pours out a cloudy yellowish/straw color with a solid amount of carbonation and a small white head. Aroma is of some light yeast, spice and slight fruits. Aroma of nutmeg and banana.  Looks very light and clean.  Tastes crisp with some banana peel and light hops.  Not overbearing like some Belgians of late.  An easily approachable beer.

Bottle from Capones thanks to Dean. Poured a rather boring/ugly straw yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma of grass, hay, lemon zest, dough, tropical fruit, mango and a slight hint of sourness. bottled. pours a beautiful straw yellow with a little haze to it. , beautiful white head that is very vigorous at the pour, but settles out to be a light and lacey. beautiful aromas I expect to smell with a belgian single- malty with a slight acidic tone with a little bit of fruityness- usually giving off scents of apple & pear.  flavor starts out refreshing and clean, then transcends into the same flavors as the aroma. nice semi dry finish, leaving a beautiful bitter flavor on the palate. one of my favorite beers from Russian River yet.

Batch 009.  The beer pours a very hazy, gold color with a full, white, fluffy head which settles to a thin pillowy layer and leaves scattered, Belgian lace.  The nose is pleasant with fresh herbal notes (bay leaves, sage), subtle light candi sugar, soft sweet breads, and a light coriander.  The flavor is similar with similar herbal notes, more leafy and woodsy notes emerging, coriander, and very faint bread tones.  The palate is very soft and silky feeling, soft to lively, and light to medium in body.  The beer finishes drying with a moderate bitterness, still very leafy, and almost a lemon peel tinge.  Interesting take on the Belgian single with just what I was expecting in the nose but something different in the flavor.  Much more bitter and dry than I thought it would be, but I guess that is why RR says this beer is "styled" after a Belgian single and not a copy of one.  The palate was perfect for the beer allowing the subtleties to emerge.  Nice table strength Belgian from RR.

draft at Russian River. pale, cloudy yellow (hoegaardenish) coriander, orange curcao, nice flavor, noncomplex. very drinkable blonde

375ml bottle as an extra in trade.  Thanks!  Pours a bright yellow color with a white head and some lacing.  Aroma is yeasty, bread, and a little banana.  Medium on the palate with fine carbonation.  Flavor is lightly sweet, bread, and a little spicy.  A very good beer.

Bottle, batch#8. Clear light golden color/ fleeting white head. Nice bready pale wheat, dry hay, corn bread aromas. medium bodied with a soft mouthfeel. Dry hay, pale wheat, dry spice flavors, nicely dry finish-good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Fruity but not sweet - smelling aroma.  Herbal hops overlay a classic Belgian yeastiness.  Solid, but nothing special and certainly not as superb as most of Russian Rivers sours.

2/10/10 notes: brewpub sampler. Light gold in color, intricate blend of soft spices. Palate is light, but appropriate. Flavor has interesting spice mix that does well with hoppier elements. This beer has enough going on that it holds up nicely.

375 ml bottle batch 8. Pours a cloudy yellow straw colour with a one finger finger head and soapy lacing. Nose- lemon, lime, very slight spice. Taste- lemon grass, lime leaves,pepper, bready yeast and moderate hopping for nice punch of bitterness. Very crisp mouthfeel and refreshing as hell. A fantastic belgian style session ale
Pours a hazy, light yellow.  Aroma is minimal.  First flavor is the typical Belgian yeast  then it stays at the same level for the rest of the sip.  Very light.  Some tannic wine qualities too.

Batch 008.  Enjoyed from a 13oz bottle in a chalice.  The beer pours a moderately hazy straw-colored yellow, with a moderate white head.  The nose shows characters of very light lemon, the Chimay yeast strains characteristic ester profile, and a very slight note of tartness.  Malt or hops do not seem to come through in any meaningful manner.  The flavor profile is truly illustrative of the seemingly boundless skill of the brewer, showing a level of depth and refinement seen in no other similar beers or examples of the style.  Lemon zest; slight grain notes, perhaps from pilsner malt; and ester-derived complexity that almost indicates the addition of a wild yeast strain, in addition to the aforesaid culture.  The finish is nicely dry and crisp.  Overall, perhaps the benchmark of the Belgian Pale Ale style, and an absolutely excellent effort.
Bottle. golden color. very simple taste of yeast and malt.  great for just needing an easy to drink beer or something to wake up your taste buds.

Kind of a thirst quencer - very refreshing taste
Very yeasty and dry on the taste - was expecting sour because of consecration, but still a very good beer - will be looking for this in the future.......

Aroma comes across with light fruit notes with a healthy yeast smell behind it. Appearance is  very light golden color. Taste is great. It is a light belgian single having a very similar taste to how is smelled. Overall I enjoyed this beer, however; I dont find it to be head and shoulders above the rest.

375ml bottle poured into a tulip glass.  Batch 008 purchased at Perrys Liquors in LIvermore.  Aroma is of straw and grass, very grainy with some doughy notes.  Appearance is light cloudy yellow with a pillowy white head that dissipates rather quickly.  The taste is lightly sweet at first with fruity flavors and some spice like corriander.  They hops provide a nice balance of bitterness that rounds the beer out nicely.  Very drinkable.  Reminds me of something that Ommegang would brew.  A solid beer all around.
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow blond. Nose of yeast, lemongrass, fruit skin and wheat. Taste is very grainy. Lots of lemongrass, spice, yeast and wheat.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured clear yellow color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate citrus and yeast aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met.

Served from a 375 mL bottle of batch 008 from OTM. The apperance is a pale straw hue that is cloudy from the bottle conditioning. The aromas are a barnyard and some fresh bread dough  heavy with yeast. The flavors follow the heavily yeasted bread dough, with the barnyard notes being very complimentary. There are additions of white pepper,  light lemon with a kiss of coriander as well. The mouth is medium bodied with a nice medium length lightly grassy finish. Perfect amount of carbonation. Very plenteously surprised with this brew.

Pours a straw yellow color with lacy pure white head. Aroma is of funky yeast, and some spice. Tastes are surprisingly pungent, with pepper, citrus, and the funky yeast coming out the most to me. Easily drinkable, and very light on the palate, with each sip dancing around on the tongue. Carbonation was less than expected, but very noticeable still and pleasant.

Bottle from Healthy Spirits, San Francisco. Very pallid golden pour with a thin white head. Sweetish nose with notes of yeast and summer/citrus fruit. Quite lively carbonation. Flavour was similar with notes of spice and grassy hop. Vague tartness. Dried out towards the finish. Clean, easy drinking and pretty likable stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2011 Sample at the brewpub. This brew pours a hazy yellow-gold color with a medium bone white head that recedes steadily. Rings of lacing. Aroma of doughy malt, pepper and fruit. Medium body with flavors of yeast, sweet malt, spices and fruit. The finish is citrus and yeast with a sweet aftertaste. Above average overall.

Bottle from Secret Santa 2010 (changeup45)
An overall mild brew with notes of yeast, lemon, and light fruit.  The flavor is very clean and ends in a dry finish.  Nothing about this one really grabbed my attention.  Very smooth and drinkable though.   Simple, but not bad by any means.  Triples/Blonde Ales are not a preferred style of mine, but this one does hold up well against similar competition.

Redemption - ... the act of saving from evil (of the year of 2010 for me.) And I would like to return the shout outs to leafs93 and Chalsk being that we enjoyed so many good brews and ratings in 2010 a "redeemer" of the year - this one is for them. This abbey single pours lemon cloudy bright with a beautiful big lacey head. The aroma is citrus with just a TOUCH of Brett, which I believe is in the bottled version - really smooth in the nose. The body is light, but full and crisp. The flavor is delicious, like a light tripel with the spiciness settling softly on the tongue.
Bottle, thx tarheels. Pours golden with a big white head. Flavor is lightly sweet, grassy, lemon, candy sugar, very refreshing.
smells like sour grass.  sweet lemon, lightly salty, orange blossom honey.  very drinkable.

375 ml bottle.

Aroma: Clean, fresh malt aroma. Slightly yeasty, lemony.

Appearance: Clear golden pour, very bubbly, foamy bright white head. Good lacing. Excellent.

Taste: Clean malt flavor, Fruity, slightly floral hops, yeasty esters, lemony, nicely bitter finish.

Palate: Bubbly, light, refreshing.

Overall: Excellent. This would be a big hit as the daily beer for any monk around. Light on the palate, refreshing, full of flavor.

(375ml bottle batch 8) golden color with a film of fine white bubbles. Nose of Belgian yeast, golden raisins, light brett, and sweet crackers. Taste of cracker, dry rye, spicy white peppercorns, Belgian yeast, pretty plain but enjoyable. Oily body with a dry palate finish.
Sample at Ocean Beach Pizza Port. Very clean belgian. Notes of clove and other spices. Good easy drinking, especially for the ABV. Russian River does it again!
375ml bottle pours a hazy, bright yellow with a thin, cloudy white head.  Nose is sweet, sugary, tropical fruits.  Flavor is sweet, sugary, yeasty, bready, potatoes.  Medium bodied.  Kind of Blah.
Beautiful white head on a yellow body. Faint malts and yeast in the aroma. The body is incredible. Dry & yeasty with green tea and hay.
Gold in color with a nice thick frothy off-white head. Aroma is fresh, hoppy and spicy. Flavor is lightly hoppy, a little grass and some grain. Light and refreshing.

b008. Transplucent pale yellow, frothy white head.  Nose of dough, pepper, light grass, little bit of a flaky crust. Flavor similar, lots of crust. Very soft profile, flavor pleasant and drinkable, lightly refreshing bitterness. Not a lot of interplay, but a lot of enjoyable flavors stacked on each other, and a bread pepper finish.

Bottle shared with Linh at Toronado. Pours a cloudy golden yellow body with slight carbonation and white lacing. Aroma is standard belgian spice, some candy as well. Mouthfeel is slightly carbonated with notes of Belgian spice and champagne yeast.

Poured a cloudy lite color like lemonade.   Lite head dissipated.  Aroma of citrus and bubblegum.  Taste is lite sweetness with lite bitter, almost stale bitter.  Lite bodied.  Slick texture, ave carbonation.  Expected better.

Batch 008.  Pours a light cloudy yellow/straw color.  Aroma is light citrus and hay.  Taste is mildly sweet at the start but quickly taken over by bitter balance The finish is very crisp and dry. A little more towards the bitter side than balanced.

Lemon citrus aroma with a bit of champagne grape. Flavor is light, crisp, fruity, and dry. A little banana, toasty bread, and wheat. Very light but refreshing and still pretty tasty. It is leaving me a little wanting though in the depth and body but this is a good replacement for an IPA or another summerish style of beer.

Bottle from Secret Santa, thanks man!  Batch 8.  Pours hazy yellow orange.  Aroma is yeasty, hay, grass,  light doughiness.  Flavor has light citrus, grass, hay,  some orange rind.  Very nice and dry.  Light, effervescent mouthfeel.  Finishes very dry.   Definitely a favorite.  Very, very excellent beer.

Redemption 375ml bottle, batch 008, listed as 5.15%, opened with a pop!  gentle pour into wb tulip.  still created huge white head, it dissipated but stuck to the glass.  Beautiful orange color with golden highlights.  Nose of grass and hay, like a unfiltered farmhouse ale.  I dont think there is still brett in these batches?  Not too funky but a little musky.  Not off putting at all.  Taste of yeast, citrus, biscuit with some spice.  Refreshing, even though a little dry.  Dry and slightly bitter ending.

375mL bottle.  Pours a hazy golden body with a bright white head.  Aroma is yeasty.  Flavor is dry, yeasty, and bitter.  Not my favorite RR beer, by far, but still very good.  Has a natural, earthy quality to it.

Tihs poured a cloudy very light yellow almost white with a normal sized white head. Aroma was of slightly skunky and grassy hops, and some belgian yeasty notes. Flavor was almost non existent, but some yeastyness and light light spices. This beer is so damn dry its amazing and very intruiging.

On tap at Russian River in August 2009.

A: Pours a bright gold with a nice and fluffy white head that drops down into a few nice rings of lacing.

S: A little bit of earthiness to go along with some citrus and yeast.

T: A little bit of sweetness from the malt as well as some citrus fruits and yeast characteristics; floral and earthy hops make it slightly bitter.

M: Medium-bodied with good carbonation.

D: Very drinkable and a great example of the style.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-04-2009

Batch 3, 375 ml bottle courtesy of MrChopin, thanks!  Cloudy yellow, big white head.  Aroma of sour orange peel and light spice.  Great body, dry, smooth, slightly sweet but ultimately sour.  Nice character and complexity.
Batch 5, 375 ml bottle, also from MrChopin.  Not as complex or smooth, lighter body.  Still decent stuff.

Hazy golden pour with a thick white head.  Aroma is Belgian spice and peppery notes.  Flavor is a little watery, but some good spice notes, some yeastiness and some good Belgian character.  Tasted blind I almost would have called this a saison.  Good beer.
On Tap at Falling Rock. Taste is a little earthy, some wheaty undertones, very wet to the mouth and makes me want to drink more and more. This would be a prefect session if not for the pricetag.
On tap.  Belgian yeast aroma with spice and pepper.  Straw color, white head.  Crisp, light malt with belgian yeast and spiciness. Nice.

On tap tonight at SD Brewing Co.  What a great bar and what a great beer.  Hazy light yellow with bright white head.  Nose spicy yeast and light light belgian fruitiness.  More lemon spice, ala saison.  Taste is same.  Light fruitiness and spiciness.  Lemon and high tea mintiness.  Nice brew, damnit!

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2011 375mL b8 courtesy of wavers1. Pours a clear to hazy bright straw with a medium, lively, bright white head with good retention and excellent lace. Aroma is at first grainy, lemon zest, and then full of Belgian yeast, phenols, cream of wheat, lemongrass, flowers, honey. Fresh cut flowers and freshly mowed grass.  Taste is biscuity, creamy, full of dough and sweet rolls then turns sharp, dry, grassy, Saaz hoppy. A tad thin and perhaps watery. Palate is so soft, dry, sharp. Really just so infinitely simple yet well constructed. Reminds me a bit of Taras Boulba. 11/9/2010 7/4/7/5/14=3.7 750mL b3 courtesy of wavers1. The pour is a gorgeous cloudy golden with a healthy, bright white head with excellent retention and swathes of lace. Aroma is outstanding: no Brett but there is an abundance of light fruits (apricots, peach, pineapple), orange mint, peppermint, heavy yeast esters and light phenol. Taste has become relatively voided from the age: watery, bland, some heavy yeast esters and mint dominating. Not really refreshing as the phenol character is really taking control. Mouthfeel is soft and neutral. Hasnt aged gracefully Im afraid. 1/1/2011 8/4/6/4/13=3.5

Batch 8. Bottle from Stefanje.  Many thanks. A expertly balanced Belgian ale.  Malts, spices and yeast blend evenly which equates to a sturdy medium bodied spice.  A pleasant accompaniment to an evening read.

Bottle. 12 oz. Split with Vin. Pours an insanely light, almost blonde, yellow with an initially rich and creamy white head, which recedes to leave a slight lace across the surface. Aroma of light hay, lemon, honey, and bits of pepper and yeasty dough. Medium bodied with a soft, very finely carbonated palate. Finish is calm and almost nonexistent. This is an odd ale, especially from Russian River. Not much to it, very little flavor or body, and certianly no sour. Hopefully Vinny will cut this out of the lineup and focus more energy on producing Consecration, Supplication, and Temptation.

batch 008 thanks to thirdeye11.  cloudy yellow with a white head.  nose is slightly tart, brett, belgian yeast, and light musk.  thin on the palate, flavors pretty much match the nose, minus the slight tartness.

Thanks to thirdeye11 for sharing this bottle. Batch 008,

The beer pours a very light yellow color with a white head. The aroma is lemons, wheat, oranges and Belgian yeast. The flavor is yeast, citrus fruit, pepper and bubblegum. The beer is very juicy tasting. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. 

Not incredibly complex, but a nice, flavorful Belgian single. Glad I got to try this one.
Tasted on tap at Falling Rock in Denver, Colorado.  Light golden appearance with thick head.  Nice golden blonde Belgian aroma.  Smooth Belgian ale.  Good but not fantastic.

Batch 008, tasted from a 375mL bottle purchased at K&L Redwood, thanks Dan.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick white head that slowly recedes to spotty lace.  The nose is bread yeast with some sweetness and and a light citrus aroma.  The flavor is very dry, but similar to the nose with yeast, lemon citrus, and bread.  The body is light and sticky with sparkling carbonation and a long lemon and yeast finish.

350ml bottle from Total Wine-Brea. Pours hazy yellow with fizzy white head. Aromas of lemon, yeast, belgain spices. Flavor of lemon, banana, yeast, light bready malts. Light and refreshing. No sourness of all. Nice light belgain ale.

Tap at Falling Rock - a very light, crisp and refreshing belgian, with earthy, saison-ish notes throughout - a bit of sweetness up front compliments the light estery profile - but middle through the finish brings dry, crisp herbal bitterness, some flinty dryness and a mild, fruity tartness - very quaffable - light, subtle.

on tap at toronado in SD. pours a very pale, clear, yellow-gold with a thick, creamy, white head and light, drippy lace. aroma is very nice with sweet/spiced belgian yeast, light banana esters, tulip petals, and toasted malts with a hint of citrus. flavor is great with a unique blend of light tartness, lemon zest, and wood with sweet belgian yeast, spices, and fruity esters with a hint of grassy funk. palate is light bodied with lively, refreshing carbonation and a dry, bitter finish. overall, a great light belgian ale.
Batch 008.  Pour was golden blonde.  Herbs and floral aromas.  Taste was dry and light with herbs, lemons, and earthy saison notes....

Tap at Toronado San Diego ($5).  Pours a clear light golden hue with one finger of white foam.  Aroma is flowers, fruit (lemon mainly and also some sweet citrus), Belgian yeast, and sweet bready malts.  Flavor has a significant amount of lemon and also yeast, bready malts, pepper, and a little bit of detectable "funk" tones.  The finish is dry and semi-tart ending with some hoppy bitterness.  Probably a weaker link in Russian Rivers great Belgian-style ale collection, but this is quite drinkable.  (240, 399)

Bottle shared by lushawn- thanks again, Shawn!  Batch 008, 5.15% ABV.  Pours a cloudy light gold color with a small white head.  Aroma of grass, herbal floral hops, Belgian yeast, wheat, and straw.  The taste carries this on, with some pale malts present along with perfumey/potpourri-like notes.  Drinks and smells like a really light, fresh saison.  Dry finish and mouthfeel, light-bodied, mild carbonation.  Great light Belgian ale.

Pour was from a small 375 ml. bottle. The look was light golden with some white head. Nice aromas of lemon and grass. Light bodied beer with a moderate amount of carbonation. Lightly bitter with the finish on the drier side. Nicely balanced and easy and pleasant to drink.

Bottle at a little harrold family tasting.  Pours a hazed creamy yellow with a small head.   aroma is grassy,  herbal, saisonlike.  Light burnt toast,  brett and pear skin,  and grainy wheat.  Refreshing.  Light bodied.  Tasty, earthy, grassy complex saison like pale ale.  Tasty, crisp, tight.

(375ml bottle-batch 008).  Pours hazy golden color with thin white head.  Active carbonation. Nice belgian yeasty smell, a little peppery, hay and florals.  Taste is semi-sweet with a slight sour (not brett) taste.  Light bodied with thin texture.  The beer is quite peppery. I think it would be better if it were a tad sweeter, but a nice beer nonetheless. Russian River probably does as good a job at replicating the style as any American brewer.  Nice job.

375 ml bottle. 10.11.10
Pours golden yellow with a soapy white head. The nose is like a combination between a gose and a wit. The predominant notes are hay, sweet wheat, salt, coriander, and crystal malt. The taste is salt, coriander, wheat, hay, yeast, and lemon zest. The palate is perfect for the style; light, crisp, and refreshing. This goes down great...another gem from RR. Also, no lacing and mild swirling legs.

375mL bottle from Whole Foods. Aroma is very hefe weizeny. Good hefe weizen at that. Flavor is pretty much hefeweizen too, with maybe a bit of wit character. Finish shows a hint of brett, thats all. Some lager like sulfur too actually-aroma and flavor.

Bottle from Total Wine. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a thin white fizzy head. Aroma is fruity yet sweet with a nice spice finish and Belgian yeast characteristics. Very easy to drink and refreshing.

On tap at 38 Degrees Alhambra,CA
Appearance:  Pours a clear yellow gold with a fluffy cap of white foam.

Aroma: Light, floral bready nose with a slight whiff of must.

Taste: Bready crisp malt, metallic yeast, small lemon twang finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium bodied, modest, lively carbonation.

Overall:  You might think of this beer as a Belgian-Pilsner if there was such a thing. The beer is clean, crisp, and damn near perfect.

375 ml bottle.  Batch 8.  Pours a very light blonde with an inch white head leaving light lacing on the glass.  Aroma is a strong lemon zest with a bit of yeast.  Initial taste is a sweet lemon zest followed by some citrus flavors.  Finish is earthy yeast.  Light bodied.  Medium carbonation.
From a bottle,blonde,white head,coriander, average carbonation,lemon.this isnt a beer i would pay too much for

Draft @ Falling Rock. Pours slightly cloudy but sharp yellow with a big whopping head and great carbonation. Nose is  a little laid-back from what I expected, though nice and citric, touches of earthy belgian yeast. Flavor is really crisp florals and light citric lemon and spice up front, some nice bready malt and hints of funky yeast in the middle and a backend that is really well balanced dryness. Uber-drinkable.
Pours translucent amber with a citrus and yeast nose.  Dry and refreshing. Flavors of yeast and grassy hops. Light and very drinkable.

pours a slightly cloudy golden blonde color. solid white head. good retention rate and phenomenal lacing. dry aromas, sweet malts, pale of course. some honey, biscuits, with a light flowery hop aroma. tastes like a chardonnay. some honey notes in the taste. like butter and honey on a biscuit. wonderful pale malts. lightly hopped, with notes of apricots. slightly dry mouthfeel, very clean and crisp. higher carbonation rate than expected.
At the brewery.  Pours pale yellow with white head.  Tastes like typical Belgian ale.  Lemon citrus, bread, and some spices.  Drinkable, but nothing really stands out.

Batch 007 750mL bottle into snifter. Contents under pressure...huge pop with this one, luckily no gush. Pours a straw yellow with huge fluffy white head and a vortex of bubbles. Aroma a bit spicy. Light yet smooth mouth feel with moderate carbonation. Light in the flavor dept. some sweetness from the malts and a tad of spiciness from the yeast however not much, finishes a bit dry. Solid beer.

Sampled at Russian River in Santa Rosa. Pours a light pale transparent yellow. Grains are dominant - barley, like fresh grist, maybe even a bit of wheat. Its a bit dilute, and the carbonation was low.

750 ml bottle; Batch 5 purchased at the brewpub; pours clear, bright gold with huge white head fading slowly; aromas of wheat, lemons, musky malt; smells like when you walk into a homebrew shop with freshly crushed grains; dry malt, grainy with raw honey, creamy wheat; thin body with lots of light fruit, yeast and wheat; pilsner malt, hay and sweet wheat; straightforward and basic, but spot on and just about perfect; faint suspended haze with creamy wheat and sweet malt; crisp, clean, yeasty and faint fruits; love it and wish this was sold locally

bottle thanks to theepeeist.  poured yellow with a white head and some good lace.  aroma was fantastic with a touch of lemon citrus followed by white grapes and soft florals.  flavor was florals, white grapes, lemon peel, spice, and a citrus type mustiness.  light body and high carbonation.

750 ml bottle that I got in a trade. Thanks for the opportunity to try this beer! Batch #005. No mention of Brett on the bottle. Poured into my Piraat Tulip glass.

A-Body is a translucent golden hue. Pours with a 2-3 finger foamy white head that eventually fades to 1/2 finger and has perfect retention from there. Tons of lacing is left all the way down the glass. When held up to the light one can clearly see some chunks of yeast sediment floating throughout the glass. Not too much...but enough to make it almost, but not quite, perfect.

S-A nice blend of slightly tart apples, citrus, and floral hops hits the nose first. This is followed by a slight sugary sweetness and bready yeast.

T-The flavor is fairly mild upfront and showcases a hint of apple and citrus fruit flavors with a fairly mild funky yeast backbone. A big burst of floral hops comes through for the finish along with the bitterness that comes with it and a slightly funky yeast backbone. A very minimal residual bitterness lingers but is mostly dry.

P-Medium to high tingly carbonation and light somewhat yeasty body. Thinner than I would prefer in this style but still above average.

O-This is a very good Belgian Pale that could be quite sessionable. The execution of this style is done well here by Russian River. A beer that I would trade for again. Looking forward to trying more Russian River brews in the future!

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-11-2008 22:41:45

Batch 5. Its not a great looking beer, but thats one of the few less than entirely positive things that Ill say. The color is nice. Theres little head. It looks a bit like apple cider. The nose is sweet and earthy with notes of citrus, cardamom, nutmeg and farm. The flavor is spicy and very full for a 5% abv beer, even a good Belgian 5% abv beer. Its crisp and cleanly Belgian. Theres some lemon in the front and some interesting and light malt through the middle. The beer ends with a lingering bitter finish. The feel is sparkly and spicy. It has a lot of flavor and fullness even for a Belgian Pale Ale. On top of everything, its a very drinkable beer, easy on the palette, the stomach and the head.

bottle thanks to bhensonb... pours a brilliant blonde color with a massive 4 finger white fluffy head... lots of grapefruit and a touch of lemon on the nose... medium body full of carbonation and citrus flavors... nice somewhat tart finish with some Belgian yeast.  a very drinkable Belgian style ale for a Spring/Summer afternoon.

Batch 6.  Pale golden pour.  The nose is incredible.  Light lemon over a soft earthy/funky brett character.  Chewy and earthy with a lot of soft flinty, minerally character.  Zesty citrus and a lingering tropical note.  Mmmm.

On tap at the brewery/pub on PtY release 10.  Pours a pale yellow with a white head.  Nose was not strong.  Maybe too cold.  Hard to notice, but it did have yeast and bread notes.  Taste was the same yeast and bread.  Mouthfeel was medium and dry.  Unimpressed.

Tap at the brewpub. I am extremely excited to try this. Nice gold haze color with a fluffy head. Translucent appearance. Nice pungent fruit aroma. Slight peach, dough, and a Belgian sweet yeast aroma popping through. Some sugary sweet aroma is reaching the olfactories as well. I am getting a lot of Tripel like qualities from this, just because it is very sweet, sugary, and fruity. Nice light fruit and sugar flavor. The yeast flavor(s) are mixing in quite well with the peach and other undetermined fruit flavors. Yeast qualities and sugar seem to dominate the beer, both in aroma and flavor. Meh... I was expecting a lot more than this. Seems just to focus on a few qualities, but it does this well.

Batch 005 bottle shared by kmweaver on 8/29/08: Transparent bright golden pour has a thin, spotty-lacing white head.  Aroma of lightly sweet biscuity pale malts and doughy Belgian yeast with a touch of light fruity esters.  Body starts with good fullness and CO2 along with some sweet toasty malty notes and nice yeasty complexity.  Very smooth, balanced and drinkable.
A Sim rate (bottle at Lord Hobo pre-EBF event): sweet bretty and wheaty citric aroma. Bitter initial hit in the flavour with a mellow hoppiness to follow. Nice, but not incredible.

A: Redemption is a pale golden beer with a fluffy white head and lots of lacing.

S: The aroma of this beer is quite fruity. Lots of banana esters, citrus, and quite yeasty. There is also quite a strong floral aroma.

T: The flavor has a lot of yeast and malt. There is also quite a bit of banana, pear, and citrus flavor, along with a lot of floral and earthy hops.

M: The carbonation is ample and provides a nice light mouthfeel.

D: This isnt really my favorite style, but Russian River never really seems to disappoint. This beer has some good flavors and a nice light mouthfeel.

25 ounce bottle. Batch 3. Pours a hazy gold with a moderate white head and lots of sediment swirling about within. A pretty ale in my Bernie glass. Aroma is dusty, of paper and cardboard, slightly hoppy, wish I could say more about it but I cant.  Flavor has some mild hops and yeastiness, almost fruity, dry indeed. A pleasant flavor albeit a boring one. Medium carbonation, timid mouthfeel. A pleasant experience, even if a bit underwhelming due to high expectations considering its bloated score here. Overall, good.
big thanks to Pete for sharing this bottle: Pours straw gold with thin white head. Pine and citrus/grapefruit arouma. Sweet caramel malts. Finishes bitter and dry with a hint of tartness.

On tap at brewery (probably Batch 005): Light golden and clear. Really nice texture -- smooth, creamy and soft on the tongue. Grainy and pleasant malt side. Fruity and slightly spicy hop-yeast side. Nice balance.

From a growler via Scott.  Thanks!  Poured a clear golden/amber with a fluffy head.  Aroma of brett, yeast, fruit and spice.  Flavor was much of the same with some good balance; brett, yeast and fruit in nice amounts.  A bit of a bitter presence.  A pretty solid beer.
Pours dull deep yellow. Nose is lemon peel, citrus, belgian yeast and spice. Flavor is crisp citrusy malt, bready, yeasty, mild spice.

Bottle batch 3 shared by Dickinsonbeer.  Blond with flat head and lace.  Bready lemon pastry aroma with mild hay.  Sweet peachy lemon meringue  mild tart dry bitter finish with a touch of barnyard.  Dry soft palate.  Excellent.

Pours a nice clean gold with a lasting white head.  Nose of malt, earthy spices, and light citrus fruit.  Taste is bready, and follows the nose to a nice, lightly hopped, dryish finish. 
Somewhat reminiscent of a light saison in the spicing.   Mouthfeel is a little thin, but I believe is supposed to be.  This is, after all, a single meant to be enjoyed with meals and/or easy drinking.  Overall, I think this is what I would call a sophisticated session single.  Down to earth, and easy-going enough to accompany any meal, but never treading into mundane territory.  Solid and enjoyable, for sure.

Bottle courtesy of bhensonb.  Pours a clear gold with a lasting, white head.  Smells of peaches, dry maly, grassy, perfumy, some oranges.  Tastes of dry pilsner malt, earthy, spicy.  Dry as hell and a bit thin on the palate.

Courtesy of TampaBrew. Pours hazy deep gold with white head. The aroma is a bit grainy to start with modest notes of malt and little else. The taste is smooth and grainy moving toward a timid tartness. Theres not a whole lot else to say about it. Seems to lack any depth but provides a bit of watery thin refreshment.
cloudy gold pour.  Aroma is subtle and nice.  Earthy notes, yeast, and some lemon.  Flavor is yeasty, light hops, lemon, bread dough and some nice earthy flavors.  Good beer.  All RR seem to be good!

Bottle.  Poured a light, hazy, straw color with a tall white head.  Nose is fruity with mild pine notes as well as spice and yeast.   Light to medium bodied with slightly soft carbonation.   Light almost watered down flavor of spice, lemon, bread, and earth, also slightly tart.  This doesnt really strike me as a Belgian.  I love Russian River but was unimpressed by this offering.
US trip Aug/Sept 2009 - On tap at RR brewpub. Golden and inviting. Sweet bubblegum with banana aroma. Spicy banana flavour and very soft and drinkable

Youll have to take this rating with a grain of salt as I am not the biggest fan of this style of beer.  Picked up this bottle from the brewery.  I did not expect this thing to have so much pressure and almost lost an eye to the cork when I opened it.  Pours a straw yellow with a light, earthy aroma and full, white head. Good carbonation with light malty flavors mixed with an earthy sweetness.  Pretty light in body but the flavor help up pretty well.  I wasnt the biggest fan of it but I did finish the whole bottle so Im not sure that I can say I completely disliked it.

Pours thin yellow with a frothy, white head. Aroma is sweet candy, yeast, leather, lemon and orange peel. Very dry spicy, yeasty flavor. Surprisingly bitter for a belgian ale. Mostly a citrus rind bitterness. Good, but very unremarkable.

750ml bottle, batch 006 courtesy of iowaherkeye  thanks Joey!  Pours a hazy medium gold with a thick three finger stark white head that leaves chunky lacing.  The nose is spicy yeast, sour citrus and floral hops.  The taste is spice, lemon peel, light citrus hops and a touch of yeasty funk in the finish.  Medium prickly mouthfeel.  Good beer and very refreshing.  Thanks again Joey!

On tap at the brewpub on 6/30/09. Pours mild yellow, little white head.  Dont have many notes on this as it was very mild overall with only hits of sourness.  The yeast is probably the most dominant flavor, with only a touch of tartness on the finish.

At any other brewery, this is probably a standout beer, but in the company of other RR brews, it gets lost in the shuffle.

Name: Redemption 003
Date: May 24, 2009
Mode: Bottle
Source: Ticker Tasting
Appearance: hazy yellow, wispy white head, streaks of lace
Aroma: light musty straw aroma, hint of lemon
Body: creamy body
Flavor: light malt flavor, touch of sweetness is well balanced with musty earthyness, light bitterness
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.3/5.0Drinkability: 8/10

A - Hazy golden pour accompanied by a finger of white head and sticky lacing. Looks sooo lively and appetizing.

S - Bananas, Floral, Belgiany, Citrus.

T - Light floral and yeast notes. Lightly sweet in the middle ends lemony and tangy. A very juicy beer, a lemon rind finish.

M - Wonderful mouthfeel, lively carbonation, excellent bottle fermentation characteristics.

D - So much flavor for a beer with a lower ABV. A lovely highly sessionable beer.
Tap at Russian River. Light yellow pour. Hoppy grass aroma and some sweetness. Taste is sweet malt, yeast and some citrus notes.

Bottle 75cl. @ Papsoes blindtasting. [ Bottle #12. ]Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy yeasty, moderate citrus - lime, perfume. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20090501]

75cl bottle from iowaherkeye. Pours a golden amber with two finger white head that settles quickly but laces the glass. Aroma is sweet and spicy with notes of candy sugar, spice, yeast, banana, some slight yeast and bread. Flavor is sweet and malty with notes of yeast, bread, malt, caramel, honey and spice. Generally medium  body with sweet floral finish.

On tap at brewpub. Clear, pale yellow color, very little carbonation. Some light hop notes, underlying sweetness. Taste is very well-balanced, malty sweetness and hop accents, but not overly complex, making for a drinkable but rather unmemorable beer.

Batch 003.

Appearance: Pours a nearly clear, yellow body with a thin, well-fluffed, white head.

Smell: Sweet-scented arrangement of malts dotted with various notes of spice, honey, white wine, and fruits, including white peach, canned pears, and citrus.

Taste: Sweet light pale malts with perhaps some pils and wheat malt throw in the mix as well. A touch of wildflower honey and spice splashed with some Viognier and tossed with fresh-cut fruits. Hints of doughy yeast here and there. Pleasing floral qualities throughout. Light, earthy hops with just a bit of bitterness. Drying, crisp, but its also quite smooth on the satisfying finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Well carbonated.

Drinkability: Redemption is beauty and glamour and mystique and intrigue, all with a supremely high drinkability and level of refreshment.

Pours clearish gold.  aroma is vague out of the sample glass, but theres grass, gold raisin, lime, and pino grigio.  Tastes of grass, earth and hay.  Finishes dry with lingering wood and grass.  Light overall, but still seems big enough.
Clear golden with large white head. Aroma was rotten with yeast sediments. Flavour was sweet yeasty with malty and caramel notes. Finished sweet.

Bottle 75 cl. Clear yellow with a dense and firm white head with lots of lacework. Lightly fruity nose with distinct yeast. Light body, a little low in carbonation with a very discreet tartness, yeast and spices. Dry and somewhat watery finish. 010509

Batch 005. Bouteille de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal chez Goldorak. Arôme: Odeur dagrumes avec une pointe dépices et de pommes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes avec une pointe dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence dépices en arrière goût. (Rating #2390)

My Bottom Line:
Honeyed biscuits spread onto peppery yeast and leafy hop bitterness in this easygoing, round Belgian-style Ale.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam covers the hazy golden.
-This is a tad than expected. I would have preferred a slightly hoppier and drier brew.
-Effervescence is relaxing, quite soft on the tongue.
-I preferred the brett version (batch 001), but I cannot say this is not a very enjoyable quaffer.

Bottle; batch 005.

Bottled. A golden beer with a lazing off-white head. The aroma is sweet and very fruity and spicy, combined with medium notes of yeast. The aroma is sweet with notes of malt, fruit, and spicy, leading to a dry wheaty finish.

Bottle from cloudskipper. Man was this stuff delicious. Notes of tart green apple, dusty yeast notes, touch of spice, lightly sweet grain on the nose. Pours a lightly hazy light golden color with a fantastic head and good lace. The flavor has a good deal of green apple notes, lightly sweet grainy malt, dusty yeast spice, and a light bitter finish. Just a tad bit tart. Unbelievable drinkable. Bubbly carbonation, yet still smooth. I just loved this one and could drink many many more.

Pours a perfect golden yellow. Very clear with minimal haziness.
Stubborn fluffy white head. Lots of lacing.
Smells of floral notes and yeast.
Taste is very simple. clean and very light malt flavors with very delicate hops.
Not my favorite style, but fairly well done.
I dont think it was worth the money, but not bad if someone buys it for you.

#12 - Amerikaner Blind-Smagning 01-Maj-2009 hos Papsoe. Bottle. Clear yellow - white head. Licorice, rotten, yeasty, sweetness, pie, urin, wheaty, american hoppy, peppery, toasted, knækbrød (Swedish Flatbread), perfumed, herbal, tea. Wierd amarican/belgian.

#12 at papsø blind tasting
clear yellow, small thick white head
aroma :  mouldy old beer, faint honey.
flavor is mouldy, sweetish, bitter from satale b eer, balanced by sweet hops. i didnt like this one.

Bottle #12 at Papsøs blindtasting.
Cloudy yellow coloured with a huge white head.
Fruity aroma of spices hops and tea with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavour of spices, tea, hops and pine needles
Hoppy finish.

#12
Bottle. [Papsoe grand American tasting] Large creamy beige head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Somewhat clear yellow color with particles in flow. Aroma of mild pepper, peach, citrus, mixed fruity notes, light floral bitterness, yeast. Light to medium bodied with an average carbonation and light dry texture. Light sweet flavor with a hint of bitterness and acidic. Light spicy fruity finish. 5 / 2 / 6 / 3 / 12 = 2.8

Bottle.

Pours a beautiful light golden with a fluffy white head. Nice grassy almost saison nose, some orange peel, some belgian yeast esters. Lovely flavor, lightly fruity, pear and orange peel, coriander. Very easy drinking, nice dry peppery close. Im really enjoying this beer. Plenty going on, well crafted, both interesting and easy-drinking.

750ml caged and corked bottle (Batch 006) served in a tulip.  Hazy golden pour with a two-finger thick head of white foam that quickly faded away.  A small amount of lacing was left around the glass.  The aroma included pale malt, light toast, fresh grass, and a mild note of spicy yeast.  The flavor was also very mild.  Grassy hops with a pale malt sweetness, lemony citrus,  and some mildly spicy yeast.  The mouthfeel was light to medium-bodied and had a slightly watery texture.  Lightly carbonted.  Sure, its a decent beer, but its hard to get excited about considering the other Belgian styled beers in their lineup.

Bottle shared by georgiabeer at the BSP.

Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a short lived white head that recedes fairly quickly and leaves only spotty lacing.

The aroma is sweet with wheat and yeast as the main contributors with some light fruits as well.  There is an herbal spice presence that leaves a little bit of burn in the nose.

The taste has the same sweetness with wheat forming the backbone for the other flavors.  There is some fruity sweetness in the middle before the finish brings in the herbal spices and also a hints of lemony tartness in the finish.

The mouthfeel is medium bodied and very smooth for the style with lots of carbonation.

Another in the long line of solid Belgian style brew from Russian River.  This one is very drinkable and, while not the most complex of their brews, makes an extremely good session beer.

On tap at the brewpub. Nice golden pour with a fluffy midsized head. Aroma is heavy with wheat, coriander, yeast and a mild whiff of hop at the back. Flavor is very yeasty and full of spice and is quite tasty. Yet another winner from Russian River.

Tap at the brewpub: Pale golden pour with a dense white head. Sulfuric notes in the aroma. Dry and crackery, pils-like base with a lemon peel spice note and lightly flowery Euro-hops. Crisp fluffy feel. Dry flavor- a crackery base meshes with spicy phenols- white pepper, light sulfuric notes (not too apparent) and a light flowery herbal finish. Very solid and easy drinking. This is all about subtlety.

Very nice and balanced tasting ale. The yeast aroma and flavor is that unique Beligian character. It is crisp and clean. This would be an awesome hot summer day beer. Perhaps Im tainted as it is a rather cool night. 
I thought I had this beer, and perhaps I have, but this is my first rating. A killer beer amongst this style.

25.4 oz bottle, batch 005.  Clear golden orange with a fluffed marshmallow head that leaves lacy garlands.  Nose is honeysuckle, lemon, yeast and citrus peel.  Aaaaah, Russian River.  Medium light with airy carb.  Delightfully crisp.  Taste is honey, clover and citrus zest fading to a grassy bitterness.  Dry peppery finish.  Refined yet simple.  One of those all day beers.

Very light. There may be brett in there...but it is very subtle. It does not overpower the fruity taste. The brett is in the aroma. Not heavy in the taste. Lots of spices. Coriander, as others note. Pepper. Very Belgian. Bought at City Beer Store in SF.

Thanks to rustychiles for sharing this one as I was heading out the door. Pours strikingly clear with a minimal white frothy head. Aroma is amazingly fruity with plenty of noble hop character blasting through. Lots of spiciness and yeast character in both the aroma and taste. The belgian yeast is really showcased well here. I wish that I had had the time to enjoy this beer more thoroughly, as it really deserved it. Brilliant little beer.

Bottle courtesy of hophead22.

Pours a hazy golden color with a large white head. Aroma is yeast, spices, wheat, coriander. Flavor is spices, grass, coriander hops and funky yeast.

On tap @ Toronado: Golden and clearly visible through topped by a thin diminishing film of head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, spice, coriander, and grain/wheat. The flavor is a bit bland but also allows grainy malt with sour grass and sign of coriander, pepper and lime leaf. This reminded me a lot of Stones VE 04 but at the same time came across lighter yet packed with a punch of alcohol too.

750ml batch 004 bottle courtesy of either KingG or swnicholson, thanks! My bottle lists the ABV as 5.65% if that matters to anyone. The color of this beer is a beautiful, mostly clear golden with a large white head that laces the glass pretty well. It smells slightly medicinal, minerals and a hint of fruit in the back. The taste is nice, subtle, and hard to describe. This reminds me of a true Belgian but i cant think of which one. This is a very easy beer to drink and something perfect for the summer

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-09-2008 01:47:53

Bottle, batch 006.  A massive, everlasting head of spongy, off-white foam caps a hazy golden body.  Thick patches of cobweb lacing coat nearly the entire glass.  The nose is dry and bretty, quite crisp overall, with notes of fresh, honey glazed wheat and cereal grains being countered by a light, floral hopping and a dose of doughy yeast.  Hints of citrus rind and orange blossoms lend a nice, perfumy touch.  Mild, peppery spice and hints of wildflowers lend just a touch of bite to the nose.  Flavors follow suit, lightly sweet from the honey notes but well balanced, fresh, and grainy overall.  Spicy lemonpepper adds a hint of zest to the dry wheat grains, with a hint of pilsner-like creaminess working wonderfully with the doughy, semi-dry yeast.  The palate is substantial, falling just on the lively side of balanced carbonation.  Some of the peppery, grassy hops linger after the finish.  This is a beautiful singel.  I could drink this balanced, flavorful ale all day long.  Like all things Russian River, this is top notch.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Clear gold in colour with strong carbonation. Focused lemon+lime aromas backed by some grainy pilsner malts. Lots of spicy hop and spicy yeast character in the mouth with more lemony citrus, black pepper, and pilsner malts. Medium bodied, but the strong carbonation makes it feel light. Very drinkable stuff. Another great beer from Russian River!

Batch 6.  Poured a hazy yellow color with a medium sized white head.  Very yeasty aroma with citrus and rind.  Light malt.  Light metallic notes upon warming.  Citrus and malt flavor.  Light dry malt finish.  Light body.  Nothing wrong with this beer but it isnt quite my style.
Bottle batch 6, thanks max.  Pours a pale golden body with a white head.  Citrus and some lemon in the nose.  Very dry with a grain feel and a mild yeasty breadiness. not bad.

Bottle, batch 6, shared by MaxxDaddy. Big, skunky (not hop skunky, more like skunky skunky), thick and Belgian aroma, salty and savory. Herbal and salty, nice complex Belgian character, a good amount of yeast character, some malt, a bit of acidic citrus. Very nice.

In short: A basic and clean Belgian blonde ale focussing on drinkability more than complexity and originality.  Very good session beer.
How: Bottle 750ml.  Batch 004, drank when about 1 year old.  Bottles from kegbear & HogtownHarry, thanks very much my friends. 
The look: Clear blond body (gets cloudy with sediments in last 2oz of bottle) topped by a medium white head
In long: Nose of fruity Belgian yeast, vanilla ice-cream and dry grassy hops.  Taste starts off with straws with strong juicy floral & fruity notes.  Bananas, citrus, dandelions, kiwis.  Vanilla soon join in, a lot of vanilla.  That beer is very well hopped but the hop character is pleasantly hard to describe.  Its grassy, floral, a bit citrusy, hints of pine-tree, more dry than bitter.  This is really is a highly drinkable light session beer.  And a pretty good one at that.   This is the type of beer than usually doesnt score well on ratebeer.  In a blind tasting session this soft highly drinkable ale would score poorly with most ratebeerians if they cant see the Russian River label.  Because of my farm animal fetish this beer is the only Redemption I can hope for.

BATCH 003
a- pours a cloudy golden hue with a small, white, creamy head that is mostly diminishing with fair lacing
s- very subdued aromas characterized by slight fruit tartness, and grainy malt
t- light and refreshing taste that is initially effervescent and finishes extremely dry, some light apple tones, \alcohol taste is mostly hidden
m- light-bodied with a crisp, quick smooth finish that is mostly dry, adequate carbonation
d- An interesting "belgian single" that is very drinkable, the 5.3% abv is very well-masked and this could well be a session beer if only there was a bit more complexity to the taste, would be nice on a hot summer day and could pair with a whole range of entrees (fish, chicken, etc).

On tap at Russian River.  Nicely done Belgian pale ale.  Golden color with a white head. Aroma of sweet malt, light fruits, and Brett-like funk.  Flavor of lemon and spices, yeast, slight vinous notes, and caramel malt. Medium body, nice smooth palate.

Draft @ OBriens Russian River night.  Clear golden color with a white head. Aroma of malt, fruits (a bit of apple, peach, tropical fruits noes) and spicy notes. Sweetish malty flavor with caramel notes, fruits and a drier finish. Medium-bodied.

Malt and herb flavors.  A hint of sweet carmel, funk.  No Brett?  Yeast strain must be wild as it has a very odd complex funk going on.  Creamy texture is nice.  Could of told me it was belgian and Id believe it.

Batch 005-750ml bottle-pours a white head that laces and gold color.  Aroma is spice-coriander/pepper/nutmeg, orange, sweet light malt but a dry character.  Taste is spice-coriander/pepper/nutmeg, orange/lemon, some grass/herbal/floral hops, sweet light malt but a dry character, slightly musty/funky yeast.  OK effervescence.   Thanks to brewerb for the trade with jwc215 & me.

Batch 6 bottle. This golden ale poured with a fluffy white head and a floral aroma. There is a caramel malt flavor with a fruity start and a spice finish. It has that distinct flavor characteristic that lets you know its from Russian River.
Gold in color with a nice thick frothy off-white head. Aroma is fresh, hoppy and spicy. Flavor is lightly hoppy, a little grass and some grain. Light and refreshing.

Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a malty hoppy spicy aroma with some fruity hints. Sweetish malty spicy caramel flavor with some slightly tasrt fruity hints. Also some hoppy hints. Sweetish malty spicy fruity finish.

(10/28/08) Draught sample at the brewpub in Santa Rosa. 5.48%. Clear golden color with a white head. Aroma of malt, fruits (a bit of apple, peach, tropical fruits noes) and spicy notes. Sweetish malty flavor with caramel notes, fruits and a drier finish. Medium-bodied. Pleasant.
Light in color and palate, but clean.  Strong clove flavor with a bit of lemon, enough to almost hide the small bite of metal.  Similar to Damnation but not as good and mellower and toned down.
Golden yellow, malty, floral, citrus, bready, yeasty, spicey, grassy, dry finish.

Draft at RR brewpub.  Pours a clear light golden/yellow color with a bone white head.  Aroma is intense Pilsner malt.  Very malty and clean.  Cereal, crackers, fresh barley on top of some subtle but noticeable fruity esters.  The malt stands out more than the yeast character though you can tell this is a Belgian beer  its just cleaner than normal.  Taste is crisp, super dry, thirst quenching.  Fruitiness is in the taste as well but it is subtle and not intense.  Quick, bone dry finish.  This is very quaffable.  I like this style of beer and this is a good example.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2010 This is only my third Russian River beer but it doesnt take long to figure out these guys know what theyre doing. Thanks to zythum for trading this to me. Pours a golden color with a huge fluffy off-white head. Pretty good retention. The aroma is nice, yeast, light fruits and flowers with malt. Everything seems to blend together quite nicely with this. Slightly sweet malty flavor, some grass and straw or somewhat of a barnyard taste, bananas and cloves with some spices kicking in towards the finish. This is light but theres enough there to set it apart. Good one, I look forward to trying more from Russian River.  Re-Rate 11/9/09.  Batch 6 courtesy of cloudskipper.  Sometimes simple is a good thing.  Golden color huge lively white head.  Very soft and slick, refreshing, nice crisp spice to compliment the fruity and floral flavors.  I like Damnation but I think this one is even better.

25 oz bottle, Batch 004, via cloudskipper.  Pours a beautiful clear gold body with a frothy white head.  Excellent retention due to the vigorous carbonation.  Great delicate pale malt nose, no signs of being overly doughy or sticky.  Sweet perfume and light hay, just clean and perfect.  The flavor is just as soft and delicate as the nose.  No funkiness or weirdness like the Batch 1.  Floral notes with dried straw and light yeastiness.  So clean and soft, this is better than the Batch 1.  Mouthfeel is soft and light bodied with perfect refreshing gentle carbonation.  Lingering clean pale maltiness.  This was just great in its cleanliness and simplicity.  A perfect example of a beer that doesn’t try to just beat you over the head with flavor.

#5 - Gold, creamy white head.  Soft funky sour floral nose rides undercurrents of juicy pineapple and vanilla oak.  Toasted oaken vanilla core expands into flavors of sour citrus peel and hints of dry piney florals.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.   Unbelievable stuff
Batch 004.  Gold pour with a snappy white head.  Aroma of Belgian yeast and apples.  Flavor is similar with some spice and just a touch of cheese.  Light dry finish.
Tap @ RR. Clear yellow color, short head. English blonde ale, but with more hops. Also bit sharper in taste. Malty body.
On tap @ RR.  Pours a clear, golden color with minimal head.  Yeasty aroma with a hint of lemon.  Light bodied, a bit fruity with a yeasty presence.  Not very exciting.
UPDATED: OCT 12, 2008 Pours pale golden with a foamy off white head. The nose is a bit too subtle, but nice influences of herbs and honey. Same in the flavor with a delicate mouthfeel.

Sampler at the RR Brewpub (Santa Rosa, CA). Light straw body with minimal head. This beer lacked a real aroma, subtle fruity pear sweetness pervades with bready notes underneath. Mellow, refreshing, subtle. Nice flow, smooth. Nice hoppy finishing bite. Sweetness of the malt is light, but doable.

750 from Taverner.  Pours golden with a nice amber-ish tint.  Wonderful thick white head.  Really nice woodsy herbal floral hop aroma with a bit of a sugary malt character.  Pretty hoppy flavor as well.  Kind of a muted mintiness.  Pleasing malt character with a eye opening bitter finish.  Medium, mouth filling body with lively carbonation. and a balanced finish.  I could drink this beer everyday.

Aroma: sweaty (gym) stink aroma, musk, spice, but still pleasant. (if that makes any sense)
Like most russian river beers: pours completely transparent dark orange with a white soapy head. 
Flavor: Musky grass flavor, with some nut blend and acidic finish. 
Palate is a bit sharp but balanced and enjoyable.

Bottle, from the brewpub that I picked up back in July.  Batch 005.  Super nice, clean, golden color.  Nice fruity aroma.  Flavor is light, refreshing and tasty.  Kind of reminds me of a cross breed between a Belgian ale, a Hefe and a Pilsener.    Good stuff.

22 oz. batch 004. from agentsteve. pours clear golden with big white fluffy head. aroma is tart with some fruit. mouthful is dry and earthy with some spicy yeast and pleasant bitter finish. very enjoyable.

On tap at the brewpub, chalkboard states this is 5.48%Clear light golden with a one finger off-white head, down to a thick film and thicker ring.  Aroma of bananas and spicy Belgian yeast, as well as some light herbal and peppery hops.  Flavor adds a bit of earthy bitterness,  finishing semi-dry with some cereal grain and bitterness peaking around a 3.  Burps lightly herbal hops.  Light body with some light carbonation.  Only a few breaks of film in the glass to make it lacing, and not a sheet.  Not ungodly complex, but not what this beer was going for.  I?d gladly drink this with most meals.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: On Tap: Sep 2008 - Lots of light fruit notes, mainly pear and some tropical notes.  Floral component with a wet bready body and some yeast and spice.

Draught. Musky, buttery nose with spicy yeast character. Clear golden brown with a thin head but good lacing. Opens sweet with a buttery middle into a dry finish with light fruit presence. Good depth with a chewy but dry mouthfeel.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy blond with a thin head.  Decent aroma of yeast.  Pretty light beer, surprised Russian River makes such a light 6% beer.  Good flavor though, worth a try.

Bottle. Pours a hazy cloudy golden straw, some floaties, very creamy lacing and nice head. Floral notes in the nose, spicy, sweat and other dry acidic notes. Dry spicy yeasty feel, some chalky notes, very drinkable and very dry.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2009 Thanks kegbear
Corked and baled 750ml. Pours a nice orange yellow with a white froth head. Taste is very nice. A sweetish but not strong sweet taste, NIce spice bouquet.Some bubble-gum and banana Leaves a dry taste in your mouth. Good beer would drink again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: (750ml bottle, Batch 5, thanks kmweaver) Medium off-white head atop cloudy golden body.  Aroma is medium sweet, lemon, straw, yeast.  Taste is medium sweet, straw, yeast, lemon, some bread.  Dry finish.  Light-medium body.

Just received the dreaded Shipping exception from fed/ex. I needed to drink something really good so I went with this one. Thanks flexabull for this one

A batch 4 bottle poured into a snifter produced a good two fingers worth of white head. That turns to a thick lace that tops of a clear golden orange body 

Nice yeasty aroma fills my nose. With some nice sweet fruity smells as well as a spice (pepper) note in the end. Yes it’s light and refreshing 

The flavors are very light on the tongue as well bananas and citrus flavors are evident up front. The spiciness of the hops comes of well and keeps this brew extremely well balanced. Light mouth feel and good carbonation keeps this thing very drinkable 

This is now my favorite session brew of all time. It is great on a hot day and I would love to be close enough to make this one of my session brews.

Thanks to Ken for this one.  Almost clear yellow, white head without much retention.  Aroma of spicy yeast, floral, herbal, light bubblegum.  Flavor is nice and delicate, a bit of spice note from the yeast, touch of bitter bite at the finish.  Nice dry bite.

Rating #1700. Batch 005. Courtesy of kmweaver. Dirty golden body with a small white head. The nose is hay, dough, honey and lots of floral hops. The flavor is fairly dry, lightly bitter with dough, honey, herbs, flowers, dusty yeast and light pepper. Medium/light body is lively.

Thanks to McBackus for sharing.  pours a hazy light yellow.  nose is full of lemons, grass, and pepper.  reminiscent of a belgian wit more than a "single"  Not much belgian funk, very drinkable with a nice carbonation bite.

bottle batch 003 form irishboy:  pours a thick looking bright golden hay with a small white head. aroma is crisp and lite, slight hat and some candi sugar too, slight floral. flavour si great very crispmalt slight toasted grain and some floralness and grass good beer love teh style.

Bottle of Batch 003, shared by mreusch. Thanks for sharing this with us, Matt. Pours a bright, nearly clear gold with a thin white skin and some yeasty floaties; nice lace. The nose is bright, yeasty, and fairly clean with a light spiciness and little more. Light-bodied and soft with a dry, mineral finish. Mildly sour citrus, light spicy phenols and a mild mineral finish. This is a well constructed beer, but I find it just a tad uninspired. I wish I could’ve tried the first batch with brett.

750ml bottle, Batch 003, with thanks to IrishBoy.  Pours a slightly hazy golden with a slight fluffy white head, some spotty lacing.  Aroma is light spice and citrus hops.  Flavor is similar, and ends up being a very light, drinkable, mild beer.  Nice stuff albeit not overly exciting.  Thanks again Richard!

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2008 Rerate, 5.23%, draft @ Russian River.  Pours a clear, bright medium-golden color; white head with excellent lacing.  Solid aroma of honey, minerals, and overripe fruits in the aroma; nicely dry.  Medium mouthfeel: chewy honey, lightly peppery yeast, and plenty of well-attenuated Belgian fruit; a touch overripe but nicely dry and very drinkable; crisp and pleasant Belgian. Batch 005; Sampled July 2008
An average pour still manages to produce a four-finger thick, pale, off-white colored head into my large Tripel Karmeliet glass.  As the head slowly recedes it forms a mesa that sits in the middle of my glass and slopes down to meat the sides of the glass where ample lacing patterns are left sticking to the walls.  Amazingly enough, despite slowly working my way through this beer, the head never has anything less than a full covering of white froth.  The beer is a clear, amber color that shows a brilliantly clear, bright, lightly orange tinged, full gold color when held up to the light.  The aroma starts with a blast of expressive fruit notes; these are a mix of ripe pear, honeydew and golden raisins.  Other fresh aromatics of honeysuckle, sweet flower nectar, and wild flower honey also add the  sweeter smelling notes in the aroma.  A backdrop of spiciness is here though; substantial enough to anchor this beer solidly I can smell notes of bergamot, white pepper, piquant ginger, light clove and some sharp, though light, herbal notes.  Hints of crushed saltine crackers and crushed malt are just noticeable if you really dig for them.  This is a fantastically expressive aroma for a smaller beer like this; I could go on just smelling this for minutes on end.

Sweet tasting up front, as much from fruity esters as any actual sweet malt sugars.   The beer is actually quite light and quite dry, but the sweetness really is accentuated by other flavor components other than residual sugars left in the beer.  While sweet and fruity up front this finishes quite dry; both a noticeable hop bitterness and a spicy, almost astringent, piquant spice character helps to significantly dry the finish out.  Fruit flavors of spicy grapes, honeydew, super-ripe pear as well as perfectly sweet, wild flower nectar are offset by spicy notes of pepper, dried ginger, spicy higher alcohols, sharp clove, .  This is light bodied, but definitely has some heft to it that keeps this clinging a bit to the palate.  An ample carbonation offsets this as it scrubs the palate with a peppery carbonic bite.

This manages to pull off a huge presence in both nose and palate, despite being a pretty easy drinking, lighter brew.  A deep complexity manages to be eminently well integrated; this is a perfect beer for those who want to contemplate the intricacies of their beer as well as those who just want an incredibly solid, great tasting beer to session a couple of.  A second pour of this beer accents a touch of yeastiness in the nose that seems to temper the fruit notes a bit with some raw dough aromas.  This really is just a fantastic interplay between fruity esters, piquant spiciness and quaffability.

Wow, I knew this should be good, but I can’t believe how good this really is.  I wasn’t expecting to like this as much as the Brett-laden batch 001, but I might even like this one more.  A fantastically tasty creation; I am continuously wowed by Vinnie’s craftsmanship and ability to achieve such well integrated, balanced beers.  Russian River seems to operate on another plane of existence than the other American brewers.

Recieved this in a recent trade with jhenry04, thanks Jason! Redemption pours a polished brass with tiny particles that the torrent of large natural carbonation bubbles keep suspended. A bubbly two + finger cottony white head appeared on the pour and fell to a pillowy creaminess after some time leaving thick spotty lacing on the way down. The carbonation keeps the head in place throughout.

My nose is greeted with all sorts of fruitiness and spices. Green apple skins, underipe banana, and a touch of sweet pineapple toward the back. The yeast brings along a solid sprinkling of white pepper. Each swirl of the glass briefly brings forward some bubble gum. A robust nose for such a low abv. Reminds me of a quality tripel without the booziness.

The flavor follows along the lines the nose suggested although not quite as bold. The fruitiness really comes together well although a little muddled at times. A dusty yeastiness presents itself on the swallow. The bold yeastiness really brings this brew toghether nicely over the pale maltiness.

Approximately 6 oz. sample from 750 mL bottle consumed at tennisjoels tasting on 1-26-08. Batch 002. This was the fifth of ten beers that we tried. This would make a great every day beer if it were more readily available. It also seems to be sessionable (of course, its far too high in alcohol to count as a true session beer). Russian River Redemption was a big hit among all of the people at the tasting, which included RateBeerians and casual beer drinkers alike.

Batch 002 poured from a 750 into a Duvel tulip. Body is golden with a solid three fingers of bright white fluffy foam on top. This beer all of a sudden looks like a lava lamp!
